bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, March 21, 1941

div1.p: Kellogg reports on his visit with Andrus and notes suggestions Andrus made for the Cornwell painting.

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, March 21, 1941
div1.opener:
VIA AIR MAIL
257 CORNELISON AVENUE
JERSEY CITY, N. J.
March 21st, 1941
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Villa Atlantique Hotel
Palm Beach, Florida
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Yesterday afternoon, I spent two hours with
Mr. J. H. Andrus. I had with me the two oil sketches which
we brought to Rochester, and a photostat of Cornwell's last
sketch; two copies of which are enclosed with this letter.
If you should show this to Miss Agramonte, please explain to
her that the artist made no serious attempt to do a portrait
of her father for the figure standing back of Lazear. This
sketch was merely made to show the composition of the projected
painting.

Mr. Andrus told me that there certainly were
no boardwalks, and that we should use gravel walks, bordered
by whitewashed cobblestones. His suggestion will be carried
out.

I asked him if it would be permissible to
place a small dog in the lower right-hand corner. He said it
was quite alright, inasmuch as the common soldier had dogs
about the camp at the time the investigation was taking place.

In this sketch you will noe that Dr. Carroll's
back is to us; Lazear is feeding the mosquito; Drs. Agramonte
and Wood are standing near Finlay. Among the group of privates
on the left will be Kissinger, Moran, Jernigan, and perhaps
Andrus. One of the figures on the porch may be Dr. Cooke.

Our photographer in Camden, N.J. is sending
you, AIR MAIL, photographs of the two oil sketches, and a 5 x 7
kodachrome of each. I hope the latter arrives before you leave
for Havana; they have to be sent to Rochester, N.Y. for processing.

If you have an opportunity to meet Conrado
Massaguer, you will find him a most entertaining and informative
person. I have written him that you are on your way to Havana.
His address is:
856 Once Street
Havana, Cuba.
We will be awaiting your return in April!
